channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: We Are Going to Have to Live Here With Each Other
item.description: Ben Shapiro and I discuss the state — and stakes — of political disagreement in America.

item.title: JD Vance vows to carry on Kirk's legacy. And, the Fed meets to decide interest rates.
item.description: Vice President Vance hosted Charlie Kirk's podcast yesterday and vowed to carry on his friend's political legacy. And, the Federal Reserve meets to de...

item.title: Movie star and visionary Robert Redford has died at age 89
item.description: A movie star to his core, Robert Redford has died after a visionary career in cinema, including founding the Sundance Institute that transformed the m...

item.title: For first time in decades, U.S. says Colombia is falling short in drug war
item.description: For the first time in decades, the U.S. has decertified Colombia as a drug control partner — a symbolic blow to one of Washington's closest allies in ...

item.title: Hepatitis B Vaccine, Once a Public Health Win, Is Under Threat From RFK Jr.
item.description: Rates of the disease have fallen since 1991, when a vaccine committee recommended all newborns receive the shot.

item.title: F.B.I. Agents Fired by Patel Speak Out on ‘Broken’ Trust
item.description: The two agents’ accounts offer an inside view of a bureau buffeted by politics and upheaval, adding to the scrutiny of the F.B.I. director as he prepa...

item.title: Has everyday life changed due to increased ICE activity in your area? We want to know
item.description: NPR wants to hear from listeners whose lives have changed due to an increase in ICE operations, throughout the country.

item.title: A U.N. inquiry accuses Israel of genocide in Gaza, joining a rising chorus
item.description: The report issued Tuesday by experts commissioned by the United Nations' Human Rights Council calls on the international community to end the genocide...

item.title: Robert Redford, Screen Idol Turned Director and Activist, Dies at 89
item.description: He made serious topics like grief and political corruption resonate with the masses, in no small part because of his own star power.

item.title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Committee Likely to Target Hepatitis B Shot for Newborns
item.description: Committee members, some of whom are vaccine skeptics, are likely to recommend restricting the use of the shots at birth or delaying them until later i...

item.title: Live Updates: Israeli Troops Push Into Gaza City, Forcing Desperate Palestinians to Flee
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of people remained in the city with hardly anywhere to go. Israel said the ground operation, after nearly two years of war, was ...

item.title: King Charles Mourns Duchess of Kent at Catholic Funeral
item.description: The duchess, best known for her role bestowing trophies at the Wimbledon tennis tournament, was the first member of the royal family to convert to Cat...

item.title: Why Many Israelis Oppose Netanyahu’s Push Into Gaza City
item.description: Critics question what a risky advance can achieve that nearly two years of war have failed to accomplish.

item.title: Israel Strikes Houthi Sites at Hudaydah Port amid Gaza City Assault
item.description: Israel has accused the militant group of using the vital port to transfer Iranian weaponry used in recent attacks amid the wider regional war.

item.title: What a No-Fly Zone Over Ukraine Would Mean for the West
item.description: Poland suggested such a zone after a major Russian incursion. But political hesitance and military shortcomings pose clear obstacles.
